availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Christian Daubert (Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer and private in Co. D 4th KY Cav, US)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Native of Germany. Son of Christian Daubert and Catherine Daubert. Married to Carolina Stralendorf Daubert in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on December 14, 1861. Resident in Jefferson County in 1850. Served in Co. D of the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private beginning September 20, 1861. Reported sick in hospital in Louisville from October 14, 1862 to April 30, 1863. Listed as a deserter in May 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 1, p. 68A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Gillmans, p. 302B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0474.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994040, Jefferson County Births/Marriages/Deaths, p. 136.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819614.
